result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel G Krajewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
DE will provide a DNA sample/pay surcharge.
DE will pay supervision fees.
DE to comply with all assessments/programming recommended by DOC agent.
No contact with TDK or anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.
Will register on Sex Offender Registry.
DE will complete sex offender treatment(SOT).

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
Victim impact statement will be sealed as well as any documents with victims name in them.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Restitution order reducing amount owed to $235.00.  ( one copy to DOC)
from DA

Defendant Daniel G Krajewski in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF8.  No additions or corrections to PSI from the State.  State will stand mute on sentencing.  Atty Nussberger has no corrrections or additions to the PSI or the alternate PSI.  Atty Nussberger calls Larry Krajewski, oath given.  Direct by Atty Nussberger.   Witness dismissed.  Atty Nussberger calls Lenore Krajewski, oath given.  Direct by Atty Nussberger.  Cross by the State.  Witness dismissed.  Argument by Atty Nussberger.  DE makes a statement to the court.  Court questions DOC as to there sentencing recommendations.  Court will order 10 year sentence, 5 in/5 out.  DE will pay restitution of $1235.00, this will be paid during the term of extended probation, victim impact statement will be sealed as well as anything with victims name on it, DE will provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge, pay DOC supervision fees, DE will comply with all assessments/ programming recommended per DOC agent, no contact with TDK or anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by agent, will register on sex offender registry, and complete sex offender treatment(SOT).  DE will have credit for 21 days.
Restitution information. Sealed
DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR
Sealed per the court
Alternate PSI filed.
Dated 8/12/16 from Nussberger Law Office to Lori Gorsegner
Sentencing hearing on September 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Dated 5/27/16 from Nussberger Law Office to Judge Anderson.
OF Confidentiality of PSI
Sentencing hearing on August 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on June 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Must be supervised by parents, bother Andrew will be allowed to supervise, but no discussion of this case.  No access to electronic devices of any kind.  No contact with T. D. K. dob 1/7/2000.  No contact with S. K. No contact with juvenile females.
Case settlement

Defendant Daniel G Krajewski in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF8.   Agreement has been reached, Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea in case 15CF194, 16CF8 will be DRI.  DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will order a PSI be prepared, and set for sentencing.  Set for sentencing 6-14-16 @ 1:00PM.  DE has 21 days of jail credit.  Bond will be modified to reflect initials only of no contacts.   Take none monetary conditions on bond of 16CF8 and put in bond in 15CF194.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Daniel G Krajewski in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF8.  DE/Atty will waive PH.  Court instructs on waiver of PH, court will accept waiver.  Information filed this day in court by the State.  Will proceed to arraignment in both cases.  Waive reading of the information, enter plea of NG to all counts. Set for plea/sentencing 4-05-16 @ 2:00PM.  Bond continues.
